detaileddescription.para: Constructor.
Destructor.
This method handles the createEntity message. It is called by DBApp when logging in.
This method handles an add message from a BaseApp. It returns the new ID that the BaseApp has.
This method is called to inform this BaseAppMgr about a base app during recovery from the death of an old BaseAppMgr.
This method handles the message from a BaseApp that it wants to be deleted.
This method handles the update from a BaseApp/ServiceApp after it finishes initialization, which means it's ready to handle messages.

inbodydescription.para: The 'putServiceFragmentsInto' has to be here, after init is done, otherwise any service fragment that registers between 'add' and 'finishedInit' will be ignored and not able to be populated to this BaseApp.

detaileddescription.para: This method handles a message from a Base App that informs us on its current load.
This method shuts down this process.
This method responds to a shutDown message.
This method responds to a message from the DBApp that tells us to start.
This method handles a request from the DBApp for our status. The status from the CellAppMgr is retrieved and then both returned.
This method responds to a message telling us what stage of the controlled shutdown process the server is at.
This method replies whether if the server has been started.
This method processes the initialisation data from DBApp.

This method processes a message from the DBApp that restores the spaces (and space data). This comes via the BaseAppMgr mainly because DBApp doesn't have a channel to CellAppMgr and also because BaseAppMgr tells DBApp when to "start" the system.

This method handles a message to set a shared data value. This may be data that is shared between all BaseApps or all BaseApps and CellApps. The BaseAppMgr is the authoritative copy of BaseApp data but the CellAppMgr is the authoritative copy of global data (i.e. data shared between all BaseApps and all CellApps).

This method handles a message to delete a shared data value. This may be data that is shared between all BaseApps or all BaseApps and CellApps. The BaseAppMgr is the authoritative copy of BaseApp data but the CellAppMgr is the authoritative copy of global data (i.e. data shared between all BaseApps and all CellApps).
This method handles a message from a BaseApp informing us that it is ready to use its new backup hash.
This method handles a message from a BaseApp informing us that it has completed a full archive cycle. Only BaseApps with secondary databases enabled should send this message.
This method handles a request to send back the backup hash chain to the requesting address.
This method handles a message from DBAppMgr to mark that there will be shards under transition in the cluster.
This method handles an update to the DBApp map from the DBAppMgr.
This method returns the BaseApp for the given address, or NULL if none exists.
This method returns the BaseApp or BackupBaseApp associated with the input address.
This method returns the approximate number of bases on the server.
This method returns the approximate number of proxies on the server.
This method is called to let the BaseAppMgr know that there is a new CellAppMgr.
This method is called when another BaseAppMgr is started.
This method is called when another DBAppMgr is started.
This method is called when a cell application has died unexpectedly.
This method is called by machined to inform us of a base application that has died unexpectedly.
This method handles a BaseApp dying unexpectedly.
This method handles ping from InterClusterMgr
This method handles notification from InterClusterMgr about another cluster deregistration. Data related to another cluster should be cleared.
This method attempts to add a global base.
This method attempts to remove a global base.
This method attempts to add a service fragment.
This method forwards service removal request to ServiceAppSubSet.
Trigger a controlled shutdown of the entire server.
This method checks and handles the case where a BaseApp may have stopped.
This method handles a BaseApp finishing its controlled shutdown.
This method is called when a BaseApp wants to retire.

This method is called to inform CellAppMgr that the base apps are in a particular shutdown stage.
stage
Shutdown stage.
This static method returns a channel to the input address. If one does not exist, it is created.
This method initialises this object.
This method overrides the TimerHandler method to handle timer events.
This method starts the game timer.
This method is called periodically to check whether or not any base applications have timed out.

This method recovers global bases registry after the death of an old BaseAppMgr.
srcAddr
Address of a BaseApp.
data
Recovery data stream.

This method recovers shared (base and global) data after the death of an old BaseAppMgr.
data
Recovery data stream.
This method returns a subset instance reference to which the given app belongs.
This method sends the startup message to a BaseApp.

parameterdescription.para: The BaseApp to send the message to.
Whether this BaseApp is the bootstrap.

detaileddescription.para: This method synchronizes the new BaseApp with the existing BaseApps.

This method returns a subset instance reference corresponding to the given argument.
isServiceApp
Which subset to pick.

This method redirects global base mailboxes to the corresponding backup BaseApp after a BaseApp death.
baseApp
Died BaseApp.

This method notifies CellAppMgr and the remaining BaseApps about BaseApp death.
baseApp
Died BaseApp.
This method adds the watchers that are related to this object.
This method calculates whether the BaseAppMgr is currently overloaded.

This method informs base and service apps of the controlled shutdown process.
args
Shutdown stage and time.
This singleton class is the global object that is used to manage proxies and bases.
